intro: Eleutherococcus seoulensis, commonly known as Seoul ginseng, is a rare and endemic species native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, and it thrives in shaded, moist forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
